extendedInfo.description: Avare (pronounced "Av Air") is a free moving-map aviation GPS app. Note: Internet access is required only for installing the app, an aviation database, and at least 1 chart; then to update METAR/TAF, & TFR graphics & Text.Avare provides offline moving map on all FAA charts (VFR Sectional, IFR lo/hi enroute, Approach Plate, WAC & TAC); plus A/FD info, Airport Diagrams w/GPS Taxi, and Terminal Procedures. Also included: GPS status, Terrain/Elevation Maps, 50 Nearest airports, Obstacles, and more.  Some FAA Charts cover Puerto Rico, plus parts of Canada, Mexico and the Caribbean. Canadian topo moving maps and unofficial airport info are also now available and volunteers may add other countries. All of this is Completely Free with no ads! Optional donation requested to support chart server & continued development.Notice: Avare is not FAA certified.Avare Advantages:â¢Made by & for pilotsâ¢Easy to learn & useâ¢Quick & responsiveâ¢Runs on most Android devicesâ¢Free App & materialsâ¢No adsâ¢No invasive permissionsMore Features:â¢Long-press any airport on chart or type in code to set as Destination.â¢GPS ground track bearing, speed and altitude.â¢GPS distance, track line, and Time to any airport.â¢Nearest Airports (with wx color code), touch to select.â¢Basic flight leg planning.â¢Runway extension option on Destination.â¢Type in any address or coordinates and set as Destination.â¢METAR & TAF: long-press airport on chart (Internet required).â¢TFRs: Graphical TFRs and text (Internet required).â¢Terrain: USGS terrain maps.â¢Obstacles: Any over 500' AGL within 200' of GPS altitude displayed.â¢Frequencies, runways, fuel availability, & other A/FD info.â¢Landscape or Portrait display Preference, North Up or Track Up (NU/TU).â¢Draw notes directly on-screen, or Pan freely around charts (Draw/Pan).â¢Touch any two points on chart for approximate distance between them.â¢Location icon can be centered or placed anywhere on screen.â¢GPS compass direction, Bearing, and Distance to and FROM any point on the map by long-pressing one finger on that point. Great for your ATC and CTAF radio calls.Avare installation begins with the small app, which then requires an internet connection to fetch an aviation Database and at least one chart. You can then choose additional charts and materials for Avare to Download free at any time. Note: The FAA occasionally changes their charts such that outdated charts may incorrectly display your location in Avare, so be sure to Update any charts you may use in flight! We also recommend that ANY time you plan to Update a chart, you first ensure you have the latest version of Avare and its Database.Avare works on any device running Android 2.2 and newer. Note: Please see our apps4av.com website (you can use our Developer link here) for Manual Install instructions if you're unable to install here on the Play store.In addition to a Nexus 7 and other recent model devices, we test new releases on a first-gen phone running Android 2.2. The fact that Avare is designed to run fine on a minimal early phone means that on newer devices itâs even more responsive and easier to use. An inexpensive external GPS will improve reliability and accuracy (including WAAS) on most devices, and some users prefer the larger screen area of a tablet device. With a 4â³ or larger screen Avare is much easier to use and read than a paper chart, or than many 4" screen expensive FAA certified GPS devices.After installing Avare, please use the Help feature to begin. New features are being added very quickly in response to user feedback and requests, so our website sometimes lags behind our innovation. You can Contact us directly via our apps4av site to share your questions, feedback, and feature requests.Launch Note: Press the square Options button at the bottom left of the screen for Help.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: This app is great, and is being actively developed, keep up the good work. Just a few more features and it\'ll be perfect. Geo referenced plates would be nice and some more airplanes would work too. And a HSI mode would be nice to follow current course and maybe a glide slope for when you get close to your destination.
reviews.author: Jeff Sheain

reviews.title: Good app
reviews.comment: Very handy to have.
reviews.author: Ryan Short

reviews.title: Gets better all the time!
reviews.comment: Simple to use. Recommending it to all my students with a \"please donate\" appeal. Will be dropping other paid subscription and switching back to android
reviews.author: Will Ho

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: Great app. I like it better than the garmin app. I wish you would put the winds aloft and radar maps back
reviews.author: Bracken Smith

reviews.title: Excellent! :)
reviews.comment: Avare really helps me. Am a student pilot. It helps me plan and access the needed charts and information FAST for my flight. :)
reviews.author: Romer Pogi

reviews.title: Please add more cities in canada
reviews.comment: I cant use it cause it doesnt have my city, vancouver.  If you could add more cities in canada, you will find me giving you five stars. Thanks.
reviews.author: Betty Cai

reviews.title: Awesome useful app!
reviews.comment: Great backup to have in the cockpit.  Like the frequent updates.  Just keeps getting more useful.  Keep up the good work!
reviews.author: Scott Mistysyn

reviews.title: Great flight app
reviews.comment: The amount of features available in this app is amazing. Two things that bother me: When creating a flight plan with multiple airports it would be nice to be able to view the approach plates at the intermediate airports. For the drawing feature, it is nearly impossible to use it to write down AWOS/ATC information - after drawing something, lifting the pen and touching the screen again a short distance away, an unwanted line segment is drawn, making it impossible to write closely spaced letters and numbers.
reviews.author: Oscar Charlie

reviews.comment: Terrific! I\'m a flight instructor and I use it constantly as it\'s an offline map.\tDoesn\'t seem to be able to get Canadian notams.
reviews.author: Dan Cockerham

reviews.title: Awesome app
reviews.comment: Can\'t believe it\'s free. You guys rock!
reviews.author: Keith Mantel

reviews.title: Designed ONLY for multitouch devices!
reviews.comment: On my humble Huawei Ascend, there is NO way to zoom in or out (no pinch to zoom), and it is also impossible to clear the canvas once you\'ve drawn on it (no way for the app to detect you touching two points at once).  Edit: yes sir, mr. \"Apps for Aviators\" Let me run to the store right away and get a multitouch device: an iPad with ForeFlight.
reviews.author: John Doe

reviews.title: Very useful
reviews.comment: Not great for planning but useful finding you way and getting info quickly
reviews.author: Alan Plank

reviews.comment: Simply a \'must have\' app!
reviews.author: Robert Turner

reviews.title: Intuitive and Comprehensive
reviews.comment: My plans to purchase a new GPS were terminated when I discovered this app. Avare allows me the ability to navigate and flight plan with the  simple convenience of a smart phone. Avare has an intuitive layout that makes it easy to use while in flight. This is a must have for pilots looking to reduce cockpit clutter!
reviews.author: Marty Kusch

reviews.comment: Best aviation app available.
reviews.author: Mike H

reviews.title: Very Useful
reviews.comment: This is by far the best aviation app for android! The only problem them I\'m having with the app is when I exit the app even after the exit prompt the gps still constantly updates my position unless I manually force stop the app in application settings on my GS3. Other than that minor issue this app is awesome!
reviews.author: StratAvidity

reviews.title: Amazing ;)
reviews.comment: Was shown how to use it first hand by the developer and it is terrific.
reviews.author: Ali Agha

reviews.title: Awesoe app with geo referencing and all charts
reviews.comment: I have flown all over the west coast and loved this app. It would be nice to be able to store flight plans, but this is great.
reviews.author: Scott Brooksby

reviews.comment: Galaxy s4 users will love this! I flew commercial coast to coast and after gps locked in I followed the flight course [sea-iad-tys] flawlessly. Before the flight I made sure I had downloaded all appropriate charts of course. I got the flight plan from Flight Aware and found each waypoint in Avare easily. Best pilot/frequent flyer app I\'ve downloaded! I highly recommend Avare!
reviews.author: Chuck Ray

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: I still have not figured out all I can do with this. Thank you for your commitment for providing this to the Android pilots.
reviews.author: Andrew Martin
